author: ate
msg: First round of changes for JSR-168 support: still very much a work in process!
Multipart content uploads requires different handling for Servlet and Portlet
contexts.
Therefore this new interface is used for specific WebRequest implementations.
which replace the original wicket.markup.html.form.upload.MultipartWebRequest
class.

author: ate
msg: First round of changes for JSR-168 support: still very much a work in process!
The WebRequest is now made abstract to allow Servlet and Portlet specific
implementations.

author: ate
msg: First round of changes for JSR-168 support: still very much a work in process!
Because the PortletApplication extension of WebApplication requires to do
its own internalInit, its now no longer final!
And a new (empty) internalDestroy is added as well to allow PortletApplication
to cleanup on Servlet destroy.
And, a first start of abstracting the runtime context type is made by now
creating a WebSession from WebRequest instead of HttpServletRequest.

author: ate
msg: First round of changes for JSR-168 support: still very much a work in process!
Update fileupload dependency to 1.1-dev which provides PortletUpload support.
This also requires commons-io-1.0
Because fileupload-1.1-dev only is available (for now) from cvs.apache.org/repository,
we need that temporarily on the maven.repo.remote list.

author: ate
msg: merged with HEAD: fix for 1253999
